comment:
the grade "C" was my fault because life happened lol..but I would've had a easy A with this class.

professor Zargouni was OVERLY helpful to me all semester. she was the best professor ive had since coming to college. the work is hard at times but aleks will teach you/ use your resources and her stuff she provides

she allowed extensions

LOVED THIS PROFESSOR SO MUCH, SHE MADE PRECAL ONLINE IN THE SUMMER SEEM SO EASY. RESPONDS TO EMAILS FAST AND IS VERY SUPPORTIVE OF STUDENTS. TOTAL OF 3 TEST, 1 FINAL, 8 ICAS, AND HW MODULES DUE EVERY WEEK. SHE ALLOWED MULTIPLE ATTEMPTS ON QUIZZES & EXTENDS DUE DATES. DO THE ASSIGMENTS AND DO THE PRACTICE QUIZ/TEST REVIEWS AND YOU WILL GET AN A.

She's very caring of all the students as she wanted all of us to succeed in the course. She was passionate about what she taught, and it led to me having an easier understanding about what I was learning as she was willing to go over topics again, and we practiced a lot on topics that the class struggled with.

She is absolutely amazing! She is so sweet, and wants her students to learn. She provides so many helpful resources. She puts a completed version of the notes and videos to help you on D2L, and has practice work in ALEKS before every module and quiz, After every class, she would be outside at a table for half an hour to help.

She was absolutely amazing. She often pushed back deadlines to allow for more time to work and is super kind. Responds to emails with the day usually and allows cheat sheets on tests. Quizes are online with camera and tests are in person. There is a homework module on aleks every week. Bonus questions on tests and partial credit.

She cares a lot and has the most office hours I've ever seen from a professor in four years of college. She will go out of her way to help you. The material is very learnable, and is made a little more difficult as her notes can be difficult to follow along with.

Summer semester '24. She is a great professor her class is solving problems most of the time rather than reading through a PowerPoint/textbook. She has in class assignments and walks around to make sure everyone understands the material.

She is amazing!! I HIGHLY recommend taking her, she is so so understanding and very lenient with homework deadlines, the test reviews are exactly like her exams, you do use a lot of ALEKS but it's great practice. Do your work and don't fall behind and you'll get an A!!!

She is the best, plain and simple. She is so caring and understanding, and she helps you understand everything. She goes through a lot of examples so you understand how to do it. She is probably the best math teacher I have ever had. Do yourself a favor and take her!

She is extremely understanding, and if you show up to class she will help your grade! I was barely expecting a B in her class and she gave me an A because I did my assignments and showed up to class. She is very thorough during lectures and will always answer your questions.

She is so so so sweet and and genuinely cares about you. She makes sure to explain everything well and she is pretty fair in grading tests. There is a lot of work to do on ALEKS but that is how math always is. Paying attention and practicing will really help you succeed.

Great professor. She really cares about her students success and shows multiple ways to solve a problem if necessary. She's very kind and never gets upset with any question that you ask no (no matter how easy or obvious it is). She's very helpful and willing to work with you. Precal is a hard class content wise, but she's great at helping you learn

her class is ok she is super sweet and tries her best to explain everything (a little too much) but she is good there are lot of work and tbh I didn't do a lot so my grade went down her lectures are a hit or miss ALEKS explains a lot if you don't get anything, overall just a lot of work but the easy class I guess.

She's literally so awesome. She busts out all the different colored pens and highlighters on whatever notes app she uses as she gives lectures, which makes concepts really easy to understand. Plus, she's never bothered by 'stupid' questions. You could ask her, "What's 2 + 2 again?" and she'd break it down for you without judgment.

I took professor Ikbel over the summer and even though the class was accelerated it never felt that way, because she thoroughly explained topics and would skip over topics the whole class felt comfortable with. She had in class assignments and would walk around and assist every student. 11/10 HIGHLY RECOMMEND. I wish she taught calc 1.

The professor was really nice & caring. Her lectures were simple enough to follow along & understand. Technically I had an advantage since I'm familiar with calculus. Homework and quizzes due each week on Sunday's & Monday's. Tests covered material taught in class so just look over the notes which she provides as completed lecture notes online.
All around it was easy course. She does give a lot of homework on Aleks. She will extend Aleks if you just ask. She's very understanding and will work with you. I would take again 110%.

Professor Zargouni wants you to do well in her class and understands that this is a hard class. She will stay after her lectures to help with the in class assignments and she is very detailed when doing her lectures. You def need to go to class to do well in the class. She also uploads her work to D2L which helps a lot. I recommend her!

She's a really understanding teacher and if you need help she will always stay after class to talk to you. She has extended some of the Aleks things and she posts all of her power points online so you have access to everything. I would def take her again. All she does in class is go over the ICAs and modules.

This class was very difficult for me just because I suck at math! But I managed to make a C overall. The homework for this class wasnt as bad as college algebra. Homework and quizzes are online, tests and final was in person. She is willing to work with you if you have struggles, she is caring and wants her students to succeed in the class.

I took her college algrebra course, and I stink at math in general!! But as long as you work hard she will recognize that and is willing to work with you if you are struggling. She has an accent but I could understand her explainations during lectures. There is a lot of homework, but its online so try to complete it before the deadline.

She is a caring person who wants her students to succeed, but her lectures are a bit hard to follow as she goes a bit too fast for students to catch up. Her notes are a bit unorganized and hard to follow if you accidentally miss her class. Provides the notes done in class on d2l. The study guides provided on Aleks are quite helpful for the test.
She teaches so fast I basically taught myself while I was in class
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Lecture heavy

comment: She teaches way too fast and barely explains WHY shes doing certain things. She is very much EVERYWHERE when shes doing problems making it hard for us to follow along. Studied the study guides just for her to put things that werent on the study guide on the test. No formula sheet only a small card. If theres other classes open, please take them!

I took her for precalc but precalc is hard in general, but she does her absolute best to help us and answers any and all questions. Most complain about her running through the explanations but I'm used to that math wise. Do the aleks and do the study guides prior to the test! It'll help. Definitely will retake to get a better grade.

This class is not for the people that only want to do the bare minimum. It's precalc, it's difficult. However, she made it super easy. Study guides were exactly like the tests and she allowed one test retake at the end of the semester. She's amazing. 10/10 if you put the work in
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She is a very kind professor who clearly knows what she's talking about. She has an accent but I understood everything she said perfectly and it caused very little trouble. Attendance is mandatory and all of the work is done through ALEKS, which causes a lot of busywork. If you don't show up to her class, it will be a difficult course overall.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: She's a very nice professor that explains stuff through her lectures. She is easily accessible outside of class and her study guides are very similar to the tests. Beware, most of the course is done on ALEKS though, and there's a good bit of busy work as a result. She also has a strict attendance policy. She has an accent but I understood her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Everything is on ALEKS. She goes over the topics extremely fast in class, only because she posts the lecture notes later on D2L. 4 Exams (in class), 4 Quizzes (monitored ALEKS), and HW (minimum 8 topics each week). Her accent gets in the way sometimes but she does make you feel inferior when asking questions.

She was difficult to understand due to accent. I am foreign myself so I mean no judgement on her it was just hard for me to listen to. She makes you turn in a practice sheet after every lesson with barely any time to complete it. Showing up is mandatory but she makes the student feel inferior when asking questions. Would not take her ever again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Summer classes are supposed to be accelerated but this is something else. Expect homework every 2-3 days with up to 16 topics each, 4 unmonitored quizzes, 4 monitored quizzes, and 5 monitored test. If you do all of the assignments you'll pass but the test are hard since its so much in a short amount of time. She gave extra credit which helped.

She's pretty nice, but isn't really engaged with the class. It's almost entirely done on ALEKS, which is fine it just depends on what works best for you. Pay attention to due dates and you should be fine.

It is true that most of the class is done on ALEKS, an online AI-based homework-generator. But there's nothing wrong with that. The lectures are useful for getting started on a topic, then you just learn the rest yourself on ALEKS. She responds to emails and questions and is never rude. She may seem useless at times, but that's fine.

Professor Zargouni is a sweet lady and cares about her students. She makes sure to ask students if they have questions on problems. I feel like she isn't the worst at teaching nor the best. I personally didn't pay too much attention to her lectures because I found it easier learning from ALEKS -Also because I'm pretty decent in math too.

You have alot of grades, which is good because you can screw a few things up and still be fine. You will likely have 3 assignments per week, including the homework, and an occasional quiz. If you do all the homework and actually learn, the class is not hard. It is more of participating and practicing. I would definitely take her again.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: ALEKS only post-corona. Homework, quizzes, assignments, tests- ALL ALEKS. She barely grades or does anything and doesnt even check the system for errors. Only 3 tests (you can make up one) plus final which means in a span of two weeks you could be taking 3 tests (last material test, makeup test, and final). STRESS.

She goes really fast during lectures and she says raise your hand if you need anything but will then not really listen to the student if they request her to slow down or zoom out. She is kind of stubborn and her grading system is weird because she doesnt necessarily grade it, a program does, and she doesnt make sure the program is doing it right.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Zargouni is not very helpful when asking questions outside of the classroom. However, her lectures are helpful so that partly makes up for the other point. Weekly homework, lots of tests, and quizzes before tests.
I am not that good at math and I did very well in this class. You do have to show up though if you want a good grade. Also, there is homework, but it helps make the tests easier.
She is a wonderful professor and I like her teaching style. But you do have to study a lot.

Ms. Zargouni is one of the best math teachers I've ever had. As long as you show up and do the practice problems in class there is no way you can't get an A. Homework takes a long time but it is worth it when you get an A on the exam.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I love this class! I was nervous bc I haven't taken math in two years and I didn't remember anything, but Prof Zargouni really explains things well and does a lot of practice problems. Definitely go to class bc she gives out lots of bonus and it helps a lot! Graded on 4 tests and a little homework. Overall great choice!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I used to tutor trig in high school and I honestly could have taught this class better. She often took the more complicated rout when it came to solving and explaining problems. She took 25 min to teach us how to do line graphs. It was an extremely easy class if you go in knowing trig but if you have no trig background Id get a new prof

I will fully admit I am dumb as a doorknob in math. If you work hard to try to understand the concepts you will get good grades. She grades super graciously and gave me many points for my work on the tests where I didn't even know what I was trying to do. GO TO CLASS! Your in-class assignments are bonus points added to your test grades.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I only took this class because it was required to get into business school, that being said I have never taken any sort of calculus class. She could be very aggressive sometimes when emailing her, or asking her a question like we expect to know everything after one time of explaining. I've never suffered so badly in a math class. It was very hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Very sweet professor, who cares about you doing well. Sometimes the lectures can be hard to understand, but if you ask her, she will be more than willing to help. Tests and homework can be hard, but she wants you understand the material. There's around three homeworks a week, and you need to make sure to do them.

Possibly one of the worst professors I've ever had. I emailed her numerous times throughout the semester and have only gotten one reply. She does a poor job at explaining how to complete problems and almost never answers your questions in a helpful manor. Often times she canceled class and posted the notes online and expected us to understand it.

She is a pretty mediocre professor. If you HAVE to take her, youll survive but just get ready to teach yourself most of the material. I have never been bad at math but for some reason, she makes it hard. She does do extra credit for tests but she just doesnt teach the material to where it makes sense. She expects you to know A LOT.

Has an accent that is sometimes hard to understand. She is a very boring teacher overall had trouble not staying awake most the classes. class isnt mandatory but if you dont go make sure to teach yourself and do homework. If you go the class work is extra credit towards tests and is very helpful.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Attendance to class is not mandatory, she posts all the lecture notes reviewed right after class. However, if you do attend class, each day she hands out work that you turn in she counts that as extra credit for the test.

She is super nice and always ready to help you, but I don't think her teaching style worked for me. She mainly does example problems for the whole class and her explanations are long and sometimes confusing. She does give a lot of extra credit though.

In theory, this class shouldn't be that hard. The material during class and on homework does not relate to the difficulty of the material on the exams. Her exams are multiple choice so you can guess but it leaves you feeling like you're going to fail. Her exams are terribly difficult compared to the material we are taught in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Hard to understand. Caring, but not an effective teacher, so it can be hard to learn if you aren't good at Trig. Does her best to give you extra credit. Will provide scantrons if you forget. Nice about testing policies.

She is more than willing to help outside of class if you do not understand something. You will be fine if you are fresh out of college and remember the material or if you are good at math. However, this is NOT a good refresher course, nor a class that you can skip class and pass. Be prepared to teach yourself a lot because she lectures fast.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Zargouni was a great teacher. I loved her college algebra class and the act that the homework had unlimited tries. Her lectures were elongated by lots of explaining of a problem but she wants her students to understand and do good in her class
don't have to go, but sort of recommend it. she is the sweetest woman ever just don't do it...
she taught ploblems in a much extended way that made it confusing for you to understand. I love pre calc but the way she taught somehow made me forget what i already knew. Tests are very hard.

I dropped her class and will retake with someone else next semester. It's unfortunate that her accent makes her so hard to understand that it affected my performance. she also explains ways in long, unnecessary ways and makes things more complicated. not for someone who struggles with math.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Calculus is a difficult class for most no matter who your professor is. She is caring towards her students. Difficult to understand in her lectures and goes too fast. Weekly homework that does not take too much time and helps you learn the material. 4 in class multiple choice exams that are challenging, but is not too hard to get a A or B.
Accent is very hard to understand. She moves at a very fast pace and doesn't practice the problem for easier understanding. Most material has to be self taught. MyMathLab heavy.

She loves helping her students. As long as you make sure you understand how to do the work and study, you'll get an A on the tests. Sometimes the way she explains things can be a bit too jargony, but she always provides a bunch of examples, so it was never a problem. Homework due at the end of every week.

You don't have to go to her class. Just 4 tests and 1 will be dropped. She is in contact anytime and she cares. Weekly online homework. You have unlimited tries to solve the questions and get full credit. She is Awesome. I'm have her again for another class next semester.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Professor Zargouni is really nice and easy grader. Her tests are exactly like her notes and homework questions. She POSTS all her POWERPOINTS on D2l, which is very convenient. She is available outside her office hours. There is 3 easy EXTRACREDIT opportunities, which will really boost your grade.

Professor Zargouni is extremely nice and she really cares about her students. She will work with you until you understand and gives a lot of extra credit. She also posts her lectures online so if you miss class you will always know what she taught.

Professor Zargouni is a great math teacher. Attendence isn't mandatory but unless you want to read and figure out the math yourself, it's best if you just go. All you do is take notes and then take some tests. No quizzes and she always give extra credit before a test that is super easy. She is very nice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Great teacher! I took AP Calculus in high school, so my opinion on class difficulty might be a little biased. The class grading was made up of online homework that is due almost every Sunday. Three test throughout the semester that can make or break your grade. If you're good at math this will be an easy A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She teaches the material way too fast so its hard to take notes. When she goes through problems she will do it the harder and longer way verses an easy because she likes to confuse us < she said that during class. Theres a lot of hw but its all easy to get done. Dont take this class unless you plan to teach yourself.
She has an accent which makes it hard to understand her sometimes and she lectures too fast.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I can't say it was an easy A, but she did care for her students. I would prolly take again but I don't need any more math classes  (Thank God)

The professor is tough, but she tries her best to explain everything. No math is easy. If you listen and write notes, you can easily get an A. Tests are multiple choice and HW is online with lots of time to complete.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I can say that I've never actually talked to Mrs. Zargouni, and i sat in the front of the class. I passed her class pretty easy only because of my high school background. Once she gets into her lecture she'll pause and ask for questions, but everyone is too busy trying to catch up on notes that no one ask and a lot of things go misunderstood.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of the better professors for math! She gives clear and concise lectures, will walk you through MANY problems and examples. However applied calc is still relatively hard so definitely prepare to do homework and studying on your own. Her tests are multiple choice but you still gotta study! She also helps you out a lot when grading.

If you're someone like myself that isn't very good at class DO NOT choose this professor. She flies through material because she knows it so well and then gets confused by the concept of students not understanding right away. The class before the test instead of reviewing for the test she is teaching material that WONT EVEN BE ON THE TEST. Awful.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you're not good at math AVOID! She goes through the material way to fast and expects you to automatically understand it. Gets annoyed when you ask questions. Also, she doesn't even review for test. The class before the next test she goes over brand new material that won't even be on the test rather than reviewing EVEN IF YOU ASK HER TO. AVIOD!!!

Great professor who wants students to succeed. Although she assigns tons of homework on my math lab, DO IT!! I hardly ever attended class, yet did all of the homework and I got A's on all the tests. Attendance is not mandatory, however on random days in class she assigns classwork for completion which counts towards your grade...
I would not recommend! I have always done well in math and I struggled! She assigned wayyyyyyy too much homework and her lectures are not great! It is possible to do well, but takes lots of time.

It's obvious that Professor Zargouni knows her stuff. Her lectures are very useful. I didn't really have to consult the textbook while doing homework, which is very rare for a math class in my experience. Same could be said for exams. I didn't really need to do much other than reviewing the homework and lecture notes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: This professor is someone you definitely do not want to take if you struggle in math. She doesn't leave time for questions. She just talks the whole time, hardly leaving time to breathe. I got a tutor after the first week because I knew it was going to be rough. She expects you to fully understand something after just learning it 15 minutes prior.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's really good at what she does, paying attention makes it seem way easier, but she uploads the notes she does in class everyday, very helpful teacher, just ask for help and she will help you.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She will do absolutely everything do help you pass. She gives extra credit "quizzes" the class before the exam, and posts practice questions with step by step solutions. If you don't understand you can email her and she replies quick and is caring. She does have a slight accent, but if you're paying attention it is no big deal. Excellent professor.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This professor was easy, and she does not take attendance. She also posts the power points online so you could skip all the time and easily keep an A. However she does randomly give out in class quizzes and assignments. I took  her MWF class and she never gives tests on Friday, which is nice. I would take one of her classes again.

This class wasn't awful but it wasn't fun either. It's hard to understand her and she gets frustrated easily if you have a question. One test is replaced by the final, and if you complete the MyMathLab you'll more than likely get a good grade in the class. She also gives random assignments in class sometimes for a quiz grade. I'd take her again.

Gets annoyed easily because she expects everyone to be a Math major. Her accent doesn't help either. That being said, she more than makes up for it with her test's. Would probably take again if I had to.
You need to have a basic understanding of algebra to take this class. She expects it of you. She is clear to that fact. Aslong as you help yourself she will help you.

Professor Zargouni was an awesome professor. She spends time going over problems and makes sure everyone understands them. After our first test, the rest were mostly multiple choice and some short answer. Gives four random in class assignments worth a total of 10% of your grade. If you skip, you can't make them up so choose wisely.
She was a good teacher and explained very well. You really have to study for her class though. Her test were hard. As long as you study very well, you should be fine.

Professor Zargouni is not easy and you have to work hard in her class. She cares about her students and looks helpful. Attending class is important to learn. I do not like math and I did not study hard enough as I wanted but I think a student who studies a lot will do well in applied calc.

Office hours are hard to attend. Literally only go for about an hour. Lectures are sometimes confusing, but homework really helps to understand. Would recommend to attend daily because she give 10% classwork grade once in a while. Posts everything online. Only CON would be her confusing and bland lectures.

Great professor! Keep in mind that you do need basic understanding of math and algebra to even think of taking this class. Explains everything thoroughly. She does start about 5 minutes early and go all the way until the end but that's because you have so much material to cover. She's very considerate of what her students need. Overall, wonderful.
